{"step_by_step_thinking": "Maculopapular rash is a type of rash characterized by a flat, red area on the skin that is covered with small confluent bumps. It is common in several diseases and medical conditions. According to the documents, Dengue (Document 0), Rubella (Document 0), and Measles (Document 0) can present with a maculopapular rash. However, there is no mention of Zoster presenting with a maculopapular rash.", "answer_choice": "D. Zoster"}
